column2: Q
1. What is a short-term scheduler?
column3: It selects which process has to be brought into the ready queue
column4: It selects which process has to be executed next and allocates CPU
column5: It selects which process to remove from memory by swapping

column2: 2. The only state transition that is initiated by the user process itself is __________
3. The context of a process in the PCB of a process does not contain __________
column3: the value of the CPU registers

column2: 4. Virtual memory is normally implemented by ________
5. What is the ready state of a process?
column3: when process is scheduled to run after some execution
column4: when process is unable to run until some task has been completed
column5: when process is using the CPU

column2: 6. Which system call can be used by a parent process to determine the termination of child process?
7. __________ is generally faster than _________ and _________
column3: best fit, first fit, worst fit
column4: first fit, best fit, worst fit
column5: worst fit, best fit, first fit

column2: 8. External fragmentation exists when?
column3: the total memory is insufficient to satisfy a request
column4: enough total memory exists to satisfy a request but it is not contiguous
column5: a request cannot be satisfied even when the total memory is free

column2:
9. Identify the incorrect statement about compilation and execution of java
programs
column3: javac helps in compiling the java program and creates the .class files
column4: java runs the programs using the bytecode in .class files
column5: java runs the programs using the source code in .java files
column6: javac is in the JDK package and java is in the JRE packag

column2: 10. Where is the operating system placed in the memory?
column5: either low or high memory (depending on the location of interrupt vector)

column2: 11. The first fit, best fit and worst fit are strategies to select a ______
column3: process from a queue to put in memory
column4: processor to run the next process
column5: free hole from a set of available holes

column2: 12. Which of the following is not the approach to handling deadlocks
13. Semaphore is a/an _______ to solve the critical section problem.
14. Mutual exclusion implies that if a process is executing in its critical section,
column3: then no other process must be executing in their critical sections
column4: then other processes must be executing in their critical sections
column5: then all the resources of the system must be blocked until it finishes execution

column2: 15. Physical memory is broken into fixed-sized blocks called ________
16. Logical memory is broken into blocks of the same size called _________
17. With paging there is no ________ fragmentation.
18. The percentage of times a page number is found in the TLB is known as ____________
19. To avoid deadlock ____________
column3: there must be a fixed number of resources to allocate
column4: resource allocation must be done only once
column5: all deadlocked processes must be aborted

column2: 20. The process to be aborted is chosen on the basis of the following factors?
column5: how long the process has computed

column2: 21. What is Dynamic loading?
column4: loading a routine only when it is called
